incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the issue and are working towards a solution. We will share further updates as they become available.

We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for a small number of customers. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: Function Execution Issue Causing Infinite Loading

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Our team has identified an issue with some function executions, which began between 2023-10-03 18:00 and 2023-10-04 01:30 UTC, that are causing an infinite loading issue for a portion of our customers. A fix has been identified and is currently being rolled out.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented, and as of 18:03 UTC, we are no longer seeing build errors. We are continuing to monitor the results.
A portion of builds are currently experiencing failures due to a recent release. We've identified the issue and are working towards a solution.
From from 00:21 UTC to 00:47 UTC we experienced elevated Build Queue time. The issue is now resolved and Builds are completing as expected.
This incident has been resolved. We will continue to monitor the results.
A new fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are still investigating this issue and a new fix is being implemented.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating an issue with builds stuck in a queued state.

incidents.name: Elevated HTTP 500 Errors: [ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED]: Package subpath './server.edge' is not defined by "exports"

incident_updates.body:
Some customer deployments between 2023-09-21 20:33 UTC and 2023-09-22 0953 UTC saw runtime errors in serverless functions.

Impact:
Any build that used Next.js versions between v13.4.3 and v13.5.1 would have produced the runtime error in serverless functions while the build container was deployed.

Impacted customers should redeploy.

incidents.name: Increased middleware and edge function failures in pdx1

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified issue is from our upstream provider and working with them to mitigate. All pdx1 traffic are rerouted to sfo1 region at this time.
We are currently rerouting all pdx1 traffic to sfo1 region. Please contact our support team if you encounter any issues.
We are currently investigating elevated middleware and edge function failures in pdx1 region starting at 23:30 UTC.
All systems normal.
The issue with elevated build queue processing times has been fixed and the backlog has been processed. We are continuing to monitor.
We have identified that the issue causing elevated build queue processing times was only affecting Hobby users.

We are currently investigating elevated build queue processing times for a number of customers. Existing deployments and live traffic are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

We are investigating this issue with our upstream provider. This affects a very small number of customers.

We are investigating this issue with our upstream provider. This affects all Postgres database operations.

The issue has been fixed; however, redeployment may be necessary if your deployments are built during the affected period above.

We are continuing to investigate this issue.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rates with SAML Authentication

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're pleased to report that our upstream provider has addressed this issue. We will continue to closely monitor the situation and will provide additional updates if necessary.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

We are investigating elevated SAML authentication errors, where users are prompted with a "This web property is not accessible via this address." error. We have identified that the root cause is linked to an issue with an upstream provider.

Please note that existing tokens and sessions are not impacted and continue to function normally. We are actively collaborating with our upstream provider to resolve the issue. We will provide updates as more information becomes available.

Due to a problem with GitHub, some commits pushed to GitHub between 01:45 and 02:15 UTC might have trouble being deployed. Deployments from other Git providers and CLI are not affected. Affected customers may want to push again to trigger a build. For more information, see the GitHub status "Incident with Actions, Pull Requests and Webhooks": https://www.githubstatus.com/incidents/spz29wshw9mh

On 8/25/23, between the time of 15:15 UTC and 15:51 UTC, Vercel experienced downtime with our runtime logs due to a connection loss with our upstream provider. During that time, users would have been unable to access and view their logs within their Vercel dashboard.

The service was restored at 15:51 UTC on 08/25 with no data loss observed.
This incident has been resolved. Any failed builds will need to be manually re-run and will not be retried automatically.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are currently investigating a percentage of builds failing with the error "Client network socket disconnected before secure TLS connection was established".

A portion of our customers who have deployed serverless functions using a Vercel team between July 17th (12:30p UTC) and July 18th (8:54p UTC) could be experiencing truncated HTML content when their server renders on Vercel. A fix has been released. The issue has been mitigated, but people may have apps deployed with a bad version. Please redeploy your project to have the fix included.
This incident has been resolved.
We are no longer observing a degradation in DNS updates. This is due to the upstream problems with our DNS provider being resolved. We are continuing to monitor.
We are observing a degradation in DNS updates due to an ongoing issue with our upstream provider. Existing DNS records are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.
This incident has been resolved.

We are no longer seeing increased npm network errors. Our team is continuing to monitor the situation. You can watch for npm updates on their status page, here: You can watch for npm updates on their status page, here: https://status.npmjs.org/incidents/jglnklhspsnm

We are currently seeing increased npm network errors that are causing elevated 404 errors for some builds during the Install Step. Our team is continuing to monitor the situation. You can watch for npm updates on their status page, here: https://status.npmjs.org/incidents/jglnklhspsnm
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are investigating reports of delayed generation rates for SSL certificate creation caused by our upstream provider. Existing certificates generated by the Vercel platform are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.

incidents.name: DNS Record and Wildcard Certificate Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are investigating reports of delayed wildcard SSL certificate creation and DNS record updates caused by our upstream provider. This also impacts newly created KV stores.

Existing certificates, DNS records, and KV stores are not affected by this issue. We will share updates as they become available.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Missing Speed Insights and Web Analytics data

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have implemented a fix, and data collection for Speed Insights and Web Analytics is working again. We are continuing to monitor.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, Web Analytics collection is also affected from 16:19 UTC
We are currently investigating an issue with the data collection of Speed Insights that started at 14:56 UTC.

Due to an upstream service disruption, we were seeing certificate issuance delays. The upstream provider has investigated the root cause of this issuance disruption and have restored services back to normal. Please see here for further details: https://letsencrypt.status.io/pages/incident/55957a99e800baa4470002da/648b36899c7c1405303ea8c4
This incident has been resolved.
We are monitoring the upstream implementation of the fix for the issue experienced earlier. At this time, serverless function creations and invocations are working as expected.

Serverless Functions are experiencing service degradation in the IAD1 (us-east-1) region due to a major outage impacting the AWS Lambda service. For more information, see the AWS status at https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status. If affected, please update your region to cle1 and redeploy (https://vercel.com/docs/concepts/functions/serverless-functions/regions).
We are currently investigating elevated error rates for serverless functions in the iad1 region.
